item.title: Oral Presentation @IC2S2 2021
item.description:
Our work on the reaction of Dark Web Marketplaces to the COVID-19 pandemic has been accepted as an oral contribution at the International Conference on Computational Social Science (IC2S2) , happening online between July 27 and 31, 2021. This is based on our two sibling papers: Dark Web Marketplaces and COVID-19: Before the Vaccines and Dark Web Marketplaces and COVID-19: The Vaccines.

If you’re also at IC2S2 this summer, and you’re interested in knowing more/possible collaborations, do not hesitate to contact me!

item.title: "COVID-19 and Dark Web Marketplaces - The Vaccines" is out on arxiv!
item.description: COVID-19 vaccines appeared on Dark Web Marketplaces close to their official approval, and their numbers have been steadily rising since them. To know more about it, check out our arxiv

item.title: Our new paper covered in the Daily Mail
item.description:
Our recent paper “Dark Web Marketplaces and COVID-19: before the vaccine” has just been covered on the Daily Mail! For a detailed summary of our findings, read the online article here, otherwise to know more about our work, read the original paper here!

Bracci, A., Nadini, M., Aliapoulios, M. et al. Dark Web Marketplaces and COVID-19: before the vaccine. EPJ Data Sci. 10, 6 (2021). https://doi.org/10.1140/epjds/s13688-021-00259-w

item.title: Our new report is out on EPJ Data Science!
item.description:
In this work we study the effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on illicit online trade. We monitor 30 dark web marketplaces from January to November 16 2020, finding the presence of different kinds of COVID-19 related listings: PPEs, medicines (e.g. hydroxychloroquine) and medical frauds (e.g. vaccines), but also guides on scamming and COVID-19 tests. We measure their presence throughout the whole time period, showing correlations with public attention, using twitter and wikipedia, and misinformation. We finally show the indirect effect of the pandemic on these platforms, evidenced by an increase in mentions of delay and sales in non COVID-19 related listings.

To know more about our work, read the article here!

Bracci, A., Nadini, M., Aliapoulios, M. et al. Dark Web Marketplaces and COVID-19: before the vaccine. EPJ Data Sci. 10, 6 (2021). https://doi.org/10.1140/epjds/s13688-021-00259-w

item.title: Presentation at NETSCI2020
item.description:
Our work, fruit of the collaboration started at the great Complexity72h workshop, has been presented at NETSCI2020 by Benjamin! If you want more info, you can have a look at the preprint or at the slides of the presentation.

Attachments

  • netsci_2020_presentation.pdf
  • arxiv_Prep_HIV_Gonorrhea.pdf

item.title: "The COVID-19 online shadow economy" is out on arxiv!
item.description: In this work we study the effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on illicit online trade. We monitor 23 dark web marketplaces from January to July, finding the presence of different kinds of COVID-19 related listings: PPEs, medicines (e.g. hydroxychloroquine) and medical frauds (e.g. vaccines). We measure their presence throughout the whole time period, showing correlations with public attention, using twitter and wikipedia, and misinformation. We finally show the indirect effect of the pandemic on these platforms, evidenced by an increase in mentions of delay and sales in non COVID-19 related listings.
